body.p:
Frankfort Ky
16th Aug 1862
Hon Beriah Magoffin
Govenor of Kentucky
Dear Sir

I am requested by my friends & constituents to Wm Judy, Lemuel Bush & Chas Nelson to ask your excellency to grant the two former a pass to go to New York city and the latter to near Manassas Virginia. They are all union men & assure me that they are not leaving the state to evade military duty & if drafted they will return in time to perform the duty or permit to substitutes The two former had bought before the order for the draft 250 head cattle which they wish to take to the N York market. The latter wishes & had before the draft arranged to visit his aged mother near Manassas, whom he has not seen for three years. and has
been for more than a year debarred from doing so by the of armies. They are all three honest reliable men
